sentence.Network_en: After a ruinous strike, the union caved in.
sentence.Network_cn: 一场破坏性的罢工之后，工会突然服软了。

sentence.Network_en: The decision was to prove ruinous.
sentence.Network_cn: 后来证明这个决定造成了极大的危害。

sentence.Network_en: The house was in a ruinous condition.

At the same time , technical invention ruinous weapon !, 同时 , 科技发明毁灭性武器!
ruination 毁灭ruinous earthquake 破坏性地震rule of thumb 经验法则

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (also in the sense 'falling down'): from Latin ruinosus, from ruina (see ruin)

entry.tran: (花费等)极其昂贵的，贵得离谱的
entry.def: If you describe the cost of something as ruinous, you mean that it costs far more money than you can afford or than is reasonable.

example.ex: Many Britons will still fear the potentially ruinous costs of their legal system.
example.tran: 很多英国人仍然会对其司法体系可能产生的高昂费用表示担忧。

entry.def: A ruinous process or course of action is one that is likely to lead to ruin.

example.ex: The economy of the state is experiencing the ruinous effects of the conflict.
example.tran: 这个国家的经济正受到这次冲突的毁灭性影响。

means.word_mean: 1. extremely harmful; bringing physical or financial ruin;
2. causing injury or blight; especially affecting with sudden violence or plague or ruin;

sentences.sentence: "the blasting effects of the intense cold on the budding fruit"
"the blasting force of the wind blowing sharp needles of sleet in our faces"

auth_sentence.content: The weather had broken up the mountains into ruinous heaps
auth_sentence.res_content: The weather had broken up the mountains into ruinous heaps
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The weather had broken up the mountains into ruinous heaps

auth_sentence.content: But one is about to embark on a ruinous slide.
auth_sentence.res_content: But one is about to embark on a ruinous slide.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But one is about to embark on a ruinous slide.

auth_sentence.content: "In many ways film-making is ruinous," he says.
auth_sentence.res_content: "In many ways film-making is ruinous," he says.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: "In many ways film-making is ruinous," he says.

Sentence.sentence: The Big Three American carmakers—General Motors, Ford and Chrysler—accumulated ruinous costs over the post-war years, such as gold-plated health plans and pensions for workers who retired as young as 48.
The Big Three American carmakers need restructuring to survive because they cannot cope with the ruinous costs accumulated over the post-war years.
they cannot cope with the ruinous costs accumulated over the post-war years.

means.word_mean: 破坏性的;导致严重问题的;灾难性的
<正>(城镇、建筑等)破败的;严重受损的;已成废墟的

sentences.en: The house was in a ruinous condition.
